Trial_Design.evidence: This randomized, open-label study enrolled 13 women

Participants.evidence: 13 women with a body mass index (BMI) ≤30 kg/m 2 and lower abdominal subcutaneous fat suitable for small-volume liposuction

Intervention.evidence: One side below the umbilicus was injected with PC-DC. The contralateral, control side received no treatment.

Objective.evidence: The authors evaluate the effects of PC-DC treatments on body composition, adipocyte function, and mechanisms responsible for fat loss.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was change in adipose tissue thickness at baseline and 8 weeks after the final treatment.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Patients were randomized by the final digit of their Social Security numbers

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomized, open-label study enrolled 13 women

Result_Outcome.evidence: Treatment with PC-DC significantly reduced the thickness of the anterior subcutaneous abdominal fat ( P = .004).

Harms.evidence: These treatments do not appear to increase circulating markers of inflammation or affect glucose and lipid metabolism.
